intro: Lotononis pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces pale yellow to greenish flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
